action.content: Turn 0

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the book on the table, the plate on the table and the mop on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a living room now. There are a side table, a chair, a shelf, a book and a couch. The book is on the side table. There are passages to a hallway, a kitchen and a bedroom here.

> pick up book

> go to kitchen

In the kitchen, there is a table, a sink, and a mop leaning against the wall. There are plates on the table.

> pick up plate

> go back to living room

> put book on table

> put plate on table

> go to kitchen again

> pick up mop

> go back to living room

> put mop on table

> done<|endoftext|>
